intro: Romulea penzigii, commonly known as the Penzig's gladiolus, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, sword-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a single, upright inflorescence with several flowers that bloom in late summer. Romulea penzigii thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a sought-after species among horticultural enthusiasts.
